item.title: Latest Updates on Russia After the Mutiny
item.description: After the Wagner Group’s mutiny showed the unexpected fragility of President Vladimir Putin’s regime, key questions remained unanswered.

item.title: Dollar Edges Lower But Economic Concerns Should Limit Losses
item.description: The dollar edged lower as markets calmed after last week’s bouts of risk aversion due to concerns about interest rates, inflation and weak growth, but analysts expect these factors will limit the currency’s falls.

item.title: Oil Gains After Wagner Mutiny
item.description: Oil prices edged cautiously higher after an aborted mutiny in Russia added to geopolitical risks, and “the market will likely have to start pricing in a larger risk premium for oil given the growing instability in Russia,” ING said.

item.title: Greek Conservatives Score Decisive Election Win
item.description: Kyriakos Mitsotakis, head of the conservative New Democracy party and Greek prime minister for the past four years, is expected to be sworn in Monday for a second term.

item.title: Metal Prices Mixed Ahead of Light Data Week
item.description: Base metals prices were mixed and gold edged higher in early trading, with sentiment still weary about the wider economy, and ANZ highlighted poor manufacturing data in Europe and in particular Germany last week adding pressure to markets.

item.title: What's Happening With Wagner in Russia?
item.description: Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin pulled back his forces from the brink of a bloody clash with the Russian army in Moscow that threatened to plunge the country into civil war.

item.title: Why Wagner Chief Prigozhin Turned Against Putin
item.description: Military infighting, financial pressures and personal political ambitions played into the brash decision.

item.title: ECB's Sintra Forum, Inflation Data Seen Driving Eurozone Bonds This Week
item.description: The key events for eurozone government bonds this week are likely to be the euro area inflation release and the ECB’s forum in Portugal where “investors will scrutinize for guidance on monetary policy,” UniCredit Research said.

item.title: After Weekend of Chaos in Russia, Questions Remain Over Fate of Wagner
item.description: With both Vladimir Putin and Yevgeny Prigozhin silent, Russians and Western officials wonder whether the crisis is truly over.

item.title: AB Foods Lifts Profit Outlook
item.description: Associated British Foods said it expected its full-year adjusted operating profit moderately ahead of last year’s after Primark posted a 13% rise in third-quarter revenue, boosted by higher selling prices and well-received summer ranges.

item.title: Siemens Energy's Profit Warning Dents Investor Confidence
item.description: Siemens Energy’s profit warning has dented investors’ confidence not solely because of the difficult-to-quantify risks related to fixing past deliveries, but also due to the lack of visibility at Gamesa, Citi said, downgrading the stock to neutral.

item.title: Hyundai E&C Advances After $5B Saudi Contract Win
item.description: The South Korean builder’s shares rose after it secured a contract to build a petrochemical complex for Aramco’s Amiral project.

item.title: The Coast Guard opened its highest-level investigation into the implosion that killed five people aboard a submersible on a sightseeing trip to the Titanic wreckage.
item.description: The Coast Guard opened its highest-level investigation into the implosion that killed five people aboard a submersible on a sightseeing trip to the Titanic wreckage.

item.title: Three San Antonio police officers were released on bond a day after fatally shooting a hammer-wielding woman in her home.
item.description: Three San Antonio police officers were released on bond a day after fatally shooting a hammer-wielding woman in her home.

item.title: Turmoil in Russia presents Kyiv and its Western backers with the prospect that instability in Moscow will make the Ukraine conflict even deadlier.
item.description: Turmoil in Russia presents Kyiv and its Western backers with the prospect that instability in Moscow will make the Ukraine conflict even deadlier.

item.title: All the main players in Russia's worst political crisis in decades stayed out of sight Sunday, a day after the Wagner Group's mutiny showed the unexpected fragility of Putin's regime, leaving Russians and the world to wonder whether the drama was really over.
item.description: All the main players in Russia’s worst political crisis in decades stayed out of sight Sunday, a day after the Wagner Group’s mutiny showed the unexpected fragility of Putin’s regime, leaving Russians and the world to wonder whether the drama was really over.

item.title: Taiwan's coming presidential election loomed large in talks between Chinese officials and Blinken during the top U.S. diplomat's visit to Beijing, people briefed on the matter said.
item.description: Taiwan’s coming presidential election loomed large in talks between Chinese officials and Blinken during the top U.S. diplomat’s visit to Beijing, people briefed on the matter said.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: Starbucks workers disrupted operations at dozens of cafes and pledged to keep striking, citing concerns that include display of Pride decorations in stores and negotiations between unionized baristas and the coffee giant.
item.description: Starbucks workers disrupted operations at dozens of cafes and pledged to keep striking, citing concerns that include display of Pride decorations in stores and negotiations between unionized baristas and the coffee giant.

item.title: Economic growth remains mostly solid and price pressures strong across affluent countries despite sharply higher interest rates engineered by central banks over the past year to cool inflation.
item.description: Economic growth remains mostly solid and price pressures strong across affluent countries despite sharply higher interest rates engineered by central banks over the past year to cool inflation.
